Reviews.Title: Great laptop and a bargain for a touch screen!
Reviews.Author: J. Tan "Lynndo"
Reviews.Content: Nice laptop. Much better value compared to the Samsung for $200++ more expensive.And compared my sister's Toshiba 14" touch i5, this laptop serve me almost the same speed...I'm glad I save my $100 for other accessories.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba satelite 14 BP45T-S4305 3rd eddition
Reviews.Author: Dr.Sadegh  Sadeghi
Reviews.Content: I like this laptop. It comes with DVD and touch screen. It is a bit slow and I'm not sure if it accept 3d dads or not . I like it very much and it works for me. I had to start all over again with the window 8 and frankly I don't like some of its apps like Netflex. so I uninstalled the app and just use a short cut of it. If I had to decide to buy it again I would have bought this item again. Since I use it mostely for the media, I'm not that much concern about the slowness of it. The memory is adequate however if I knew how I would have increased it to the max. I have not yet figured out how t0 Video /call with it but I'll try to learn. BUT you need to know that it is not Google friendly and I have not been able to link my apps from Google to this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Dead in under a year
Reviews.Author: KenSea
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 2, because when it worked, I loved this machine.  Cute, sleek, DVD drive...but it jammed up a few months after I bought it & Geek Squad counseled me to pull battery.  This became habitual, like a smart phone when you're near your trade-in date!  Then pulling the battery no longer worked, and they told me to hold the power button while battery was out (to drain power reserves), this worked for a while.  Then on the first day of college, I tried to start up the computer & it was completely frozen on the start screen.  Gave to geek squad & was told I would lose everything on the hard drive because they had to sweep & completely reinstall the Windows 8 OS.  Waited 10 days for Toshiba to send me the recovery J-drive (and charged me $28 for it).  Computer crashed 5 days later, lost all my assignments for school.  They had to send it out for service & they had to replace the hard drive.  Two weeks later I get it back and it still doesn't work.  Geeks tried for 2 hours to reinstall OS & finally junked it and got me a refund to buy a new computer.  Got 9.5 months of use out of this computer.  (FYI, after 30 days Toshiba will NOT junk out your computer and give you another one EVER, they will just fix it and fix it!  Best Buy took one for the team!)

Reviews.Title: Touch screen is a pleasure to use
Reviews.Author: ken Schick
Reviews.Content: The computer itself is excellent! I think it should have  more memory but that can be fixed.I can't say the same for the pre-loaded windows 8 is a real pain. I tried to load windows 7 butthenew system won't allow it.

Reviews.Title: Loved this Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Howdy y'all from Texas
Reviews.Content: Only comment I can share was it wasn't fast enough to do large files and multi-tasking.  On the other hand, the price was right. I'm happy to keep it.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this touch screen laptop thinking it might be a good combination between a tablet and a regular laptop. In reality, it is too heavy to be used as a tablet and with a full keyboard you don't need touch screen. I have had it over a year and find that I hardly use the touch screen.In addition, the Windows 8 interface is rather annoying and I prefer using the Desktop interface over Windows 8 tile apps.  I am annoyed when it accidentally switches between interfaces.Updates and programs also seem to run slower over time too. I often get interruptions, slow downs and freezes.I have had Toshiba net book for years before and liked it for reliability, durability, and simple use. One thing I do like about this laptop is the wide screen for watching videos. I have only used the DVD once and don't think it's necessary to have. Almost any data can be downloaded now or be transferred with USB drive. CDs and DVDs are old school now.Overall I would not recommend this laptop or others with touch screen features or Windows 8 for general computing with a keyboard. Use Windows 7 if available. Get a simple laptop and save from unnecessary features.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop
Reviews.Author: CBB462
Reviews.Content: im loving this laptop in fact im writing this review on it right now. I got this laptop for college to access my school work and write and anything else i need it for and it's been doing wonders

Reviews.Title: Laptop vs PC?
Reviews.Author: Colleen R. Doubroff
Reviews.Content: I resisted getting a laptop to replace my PC, but I have learned to eat my words! The touchscreen has specifically helped me get over the frustration I had felt in the past when using a mouse pad to navigate around, and the keyboard action is set right for a person who can type fast. I'm using an external drive for any large files that I need stored.  I find the system very flexible and fast.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Paul Tyndale
Reviews.Content: Firstly I did not buy this laptop from amazon, my unit was purchased at best buy in atlanta. I don't think it slow it runs quit well actually. It doesn't over heat or make loud fan noises. Th screen is crystal clear and most of my Windows 7 programs work well or better in windows 8 environment.However the one problem i am having is when i watch youtube or start to use the touch screen too often, its as if all 10 points on the touch screen are appearing on the screen simultaneously its as if the 10 points are just appearing on random prts of the screen as if i had all 10 fingers on it but im not touching the screen and it does this on its own only when youtubing or using heavy adobe flash player videos. However restarting the video usually fixes issue. If all else fails a reboot is last option and always works (for now) I hope MS sends out some good updates soon for the touch screen. And one more thing: you have to tap the keys on the keyboard just a slight bit harder than other laptops but not noticeably harder.In conclusion the machine performs as you would expect a new unit would (for me anyway) apart from the touchscreen going haywire once in a while i love his laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Dario Beraldo
Reviews.Content: Great price and qualityWindows 8 is fantastic and touch pad is greatLove it the functionality and the appearance

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Laura Reyes Jp "LAURA REYES PINO"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE TOSHIBA LAPTOP JUST SEEMS A LITTLE SLOW BUT EXCELLENTI LOVE THE TOSHIBA LAPTOP JUST SEEMS A LITTLE SLOW BUT EXCELLENT

Reviews.Title: Just as described
Reviews.Author: HalfPint3305
Reviews.Content: The product was just as described. Exactly what I was looking for and exactly what I needed. Perfect for doing my school work. Thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Not bad Toshiba, not bad.
Reviews.Author: anicole
Reviews.Content: I'd first like to mention that I didn't purchase this laptop on Amazon; I bought it on eBay, brand new, in box for $500. Totally worth it. I'm upgrading from an old Toshiba Satellite from 2009 and honestly this laptop isn't all that bad. It took me maybe two hours to get used to Windows 8, although I'm sure there's some things I haven't learned yet. I only use the touchscreen when I'm on the start screen, but it's still a cool feature. The keypad and keyboard is very responsive, it's fast, it's quiet and eco-friendly. I honestly haven't dealt with any big glitches. It's running very smooth for me. However, every now and then when I'm on a page such as Chrome, I'll barely swipe the keypad and it'll switch over to like iTunes. That's the only real issue I've dealt with. I've only had this laptop for a day so I haven't been able to really test out the battery life. I'll try and update this review in about a month.Update (October 8, 2013):So, I've this laptop for2 months and it still works perfectly! My computer boots up in less than 5 seconds, everything is still smooth, my laptop is still quiet. I figured out reason why it swiped from like Chrome to iTunes and I just went to settings and fixed that issue. The battery still lasts a good while; I'm rarely on the Start screen but when I am I don't ever have any problems. Everything still works perfectly. Thanks Toshiba!

Reviews.Title: I miss my Asus.
Reviews.Author: leeannvk
Reviews.Content: I agree with the others, its glitchy and it runs really really slow. (My 3 year old $329.00 Asus was way faster) I paid $625. for it about 9 months ago and went with it because at the time that was a super deal on the unit.  I was disapointed with the machine but still really liked the touch screen and figured I needed to get more comfortable with Windows 8.I sucked it up and dealt with the issues (except on the weekends when I could bring my work issued laptop home) because I really did like the touch screen and it didn't freeze all that often using Word, Excel, which was what I really bought it for...Anyway, then I dropped it, and now I understand why the performance was so bad.  I shattered the screen.  I can find new screens all day long for $50-$60 the digitizer, the component that makes a touch screen touch sensitive, is $400.00.  That's just the cost of the parts, I'm willing to fix it myself. If the bling is that expensive, they couldn't have that great a quality on the 'go' parts!  That's like buying a car for $24,000 driving over something you shouldn't flattening, the tire and finding out the new tire will cost $16,000.  Who would have expected that.  I'll never buy another Toshiba product again.  I'm going back to Asus, which, besides being a more reliable machine is also more durable. :)  I'm not saying that somebody should fix my computer for me...it was my accident, but the parts ought to be reasonable.  IF you buy it anyway.  GET THE WARRANTY and then make them fix the glitches too! :)

Reviews.Title: Nightmare
Reviews.Author: Red98c5
Reviews.Content: As a college professor who teaches online, I have had many, many laptops.  My last Toshiba was a dream.  This computer is Satan.  The screen goes from huge to tiny on its own.  You are typing and it jumps to a totally different screen.  Sometimes when you are typing, it freezes.  Sometimes it puts annoying blue boxes around everything.  I have never, ever had a computer this bad.  It wasn't cheap and the defects in the design coupled with the hugely annoying new Windows, means most days I dream of throwing it in the lake behind my house.

Reviews.Title: Worst Laptop I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: JohnB
Reviews.Content: I have owned at least 5 laptops over the years, including 2 others from Toshiba.  This is by far the worst one I have ever used.  For a newer computer, it is dirt slow.  Booting from powering on takes a good 5-10 minutes for it to fully come up.  Bringing the computer out of sleep mode doesn't fare much better.  For some strange reason, the wifi shuts down when coming out of sleep mode, and takes 3-4 minutes before it will reconnect.  The Windows 8.1 upgrade did not make anything better or worse.I blame myself because I got sucked into the touch screen (which I never use).  I would stay clear of this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop at a Geat Price
Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: As a upcoming college student with only a month to go before starting my semester I was on the hunt for an excellent laptop for my needs and my work. I dedicated the whole day searching for a laptop. I wanted I nice size laptop 14-17 inch touchscreen, usb 3.0, a disk drive for my work, and just a stylish computer over all. Then I came across the Toshiba Satellite. It had everything I wanted and more I had to have it.Know that I have it I couldn't be more pleased.Pros: The keyboard dishing is great it fits my hand perfectly I can see myself typing for hours.The computer is very stylish with  nice silver finish.Touch screen is very responsive I love it.Windows isn't a problem I thought it would be until I got my hands on it.Its fast and get the job done well.Cons: The mouse is at first is dry and not very responsive at first but over time it gets better.That's the only cons for me.

Reviews.Title: Worst computer I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: K. Landrum "kellimco"
Reviews.Content: I wasted a lot of money on this purchase obviously.  Windows 8 is the most UN User friendly operating system EVER!!!!!  This computer fails every time I try to upload my printer to it.  Also wouldn't let me transfer picture files from my phone.  I have always been a very efficient computer user, but this is the worst OS EVER!  Also it takes forever for anything to load.  I would not recommend this product to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Satelite 14" touch-screen computer
Reviews.Author: Edward W Lancaster
Reviews.Content: Toshiba Satelite 14" Touch-screenThe computer is excellent, I love the color. It is everything I expected and more. I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Want this model, but hugely disappointing.
Reviews.Author: missalyss7
Reviews.Content: I really like the model itself, it's everything I want: small, touch screen, the surface doesn't get dirty, keyboard is nice, but its super glitchy! So far I've switched out for THREE separate computers. Two came from 2 separate Best Buys in Seattle and another (from Best Buy) in Salt Lake City. They've all had little random glitches that should NOT come in a brand new computer like: scrolling on the touch pad and touch screen not working, holding a charge at 9% (still would hold, but said it all the way down that it was 9% so I never knew when it was going to die), sound randomly turns off (while computer thinks the sound is still on), not picking up internet networks; just all over the place, all from 3 different computers. I'm really disappointed because I really liked the computer itself, but this is getting ridiculous.

4GB DDR3 memory,Multiformat DVD±RW/CD-RW drive with double-layer support,Intel® Wireless Display,Built-in high-definition webcam and microphone,
14" LED-backlit TFT-LCD high-definition widescreen touch-screen display,Mobile Intel® HD graphics,
500GB Serial ATA hard drive (5400 rpm),Multiformat media reader,3 USB 3.0 ports,
Weighs only 4.3 lbs. and measures just 1.1" thin,Built-in high-speed wireless LAN (802.11b/g/n),Etched aluminum body in prestige silver.
